item.title: [Python]Virgo
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Sorry for not posting in a while but this is a small update:

rsStat.py:

[code]import urllib, re

class Main():
def grabStat(self, user, stat):
url = urllib.FancyURLopener({})
gotSite = url.open(“YOUR WEBSITE WITH PARSER HERE?user=”+user.replace(" “, “-”))
contentSite = gotSite.read()
reString = re.compile(”

"+stat+"(.+)-"+stat+"(.+)-"+stat+"(.+)-"+stat+"")
reString2 = re.compile("<td colspan=“3”>Unranked-"+stat+"")
match = reString.search(contentSite)
match2 = reString2.search(contentSite) 
    if match:
        return stat+" Rank: "+ match.group(1) + " Level: " + match.group(2) + " XP: " + match.group(3)
    elif match2:
        return user+" is not ranked for: " + stat
    else:
        return "Failed to grab "+stat

[/code]

This is for use with a edited version of Zachera’s Runescape stat parser:

// Thank Zachera for this script, tis epic.

<?php
class RuneScapeStats {
	var $username; // Username
	var $skills = array("Overall","Attack","Defence","Strength","Hitpoints","Ranged","Prayer","Magic","Cooking","Woodcutting","Fletching","Fishing","Firemaking","Crafting","Smithing","Mining","Herblore","Agility","Thieving","Slayer","Farming","Runecraft","Hunter","Construction","Summoning","Duel-Tournament","Bounty-Hunters","Bounty Hunter Rogues","Fist of Guthix");
	var $ranks = array(); // Ranks
	var $levels = array(); // Levels
	var $experience = array(); // Experience
	public function __construct(){ // Automatically called when the class is called.
		if(isset($_GET['user'])){
			// We use file since file_get_contents isn't really necessary.
			$file = @file('http://hiscore.runescape.com/index_lite.ws?player='.$_GET['user']);
			// In a sense, this is like saying if(httpResponse == 200), since, fortunately, jagex returns a 404 on a user not found.
			if($file){
				foreach($file as $id => $stat){ // For each line; lucky us, Jagex decided to put \n after
												// displaying each skill result... *whew*.
												// Although, if they ever get rid of those \n's, this whole
												// file will fuck up and probably give
												// a load of array index not found errors.
					$skill = explode(',',trim($stat)); // Get rid of whitespace; space out the line into an array.
					array_push($this->ranks,$skill[0]); // Add ranks to array.
					array_push($this->levels,$skill[1]); // Add level to array.
					if($id < 25){ // Bounty Hunter, etc. doesn't have an experience.
						array_push($this->experience,$skill[2]); // Add experience to array.
					}
				}
				$this->username = $_GET['user']; // Set the username.
			} else {
				echo "User name doesn't exist."; // Username wasn't found.
			}
		} else {
			echo "User name hasn't been requested!"; // $_GET['user'] doesn't exist.
		}
	}
}
if(isset($_GET['user'])){ // If the username is set.
	$RuneScapeStats = new RuneScapeStats(); // Call the class -- main initiation of the whole file which starts it all.
	if(isset($RuneScapeStats->username)){ // If the username is set.
		echo '<table cellpadding="5" border="1">';
		// No matter whether the username is a lowercase on the first letter,
		// it's displayed as uppercase in RuneScape, so lets do the same for this.
		echo '<tr><td colspan="4">RuneScape Stats for <strong>'.ucfirst($_GET['user']).'</strong></td></tr>';
		echo '<tr><td>Skill</td><td>Rank</td><td>Level</td><td>Experience</td></tr>';
		for($x = 0; $x < 27; $x++){ // Lets loop through the skills and display the results.
			echo '<tr>';
			echo '<td>'.$RuneScapeStats->skills[$x].'</td>'; // Skill name
			if($RuneScapeStats->ranks[$x] > 0){ // If the rank > 0, keeps out -1's.
					echo '<td>'.number_format($RuneScapeStats->ranks[$x]).'-'.$RuneScapeStats->skills[$x].'</td>'; // Display rank
				echo '<td>'.number_format($RuneScapeStats->levels[$x]).'-'.$RuneScapeStats->skills[$x].'</td>'; // Display level
				if($x < 25){ // Keep out Bounty Hunter, etc.
					echo '<td>'.number_format($RuneScapeStats->experience[$x]).'-'.$RuneScapeStats->skills[$x].'</td>'; // Experience
				} else {
					echo '<td> </td>';
				}
			} else {
				echo '<td colspan="3"><em>Unranked-'.$RuneScapeStats->skills[$x].'</em></td>'; // Get rid of -1's.
			}
		}
		echo '</table>';
	} else {
		echo 'Cannot find the user.'; // $_GET['user'] wasn't found.
	}
} else
{
	echo 'You didn\'t specify a username to get the stats of.';
}
?>

To implement the above, you can put this in Pythirc.py:

def grabStat(self, channel, user, stat): self.chanSend(channel, rsStat.grabStat(user, stat))

And put this in Virgo.py:

if messageSent.startswith("!grab"): try: stat = messageSent.split(" ")[1] username = messageSent.partition(" ")[2] user = username.lstrip(stat+" ") IRCFunc.grabStat(currChannel, user, stat) except Exception, e: IRCFunc.chanSend(currChannel, "Upon trying to complete the given command, I have ran into an error!")

This will return something like:

!grab Attack Zezima Attack Rank: 152 Level: 99 XP: 56,994,743 !grab Overall Zezima Overall Rank: 58 Level: 2,354 XP: 1,160,736,349 !grab Ranged Zezima Ranged Rank: 69 Level: 99 XP: 35,897,315

Once again, thank you to Zachera for releasing his Runescape stat parser

item.title: [Python]Virgo
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Virgo = IRC Bot that I made, it has two major files, the small library I created for it, and the actual bot file. It’s pretty easy to customize and very simple.

Pythirc - Lib:

[code]
import socket
import re
import os
from time import sleep
import urllib
sock = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)

class IRCon(object):
def init(self, server, port):
sock.connect((server, port))

def closeIRCon(self):
    sock.send('QUIT Pythirc lib\r\n')
    sock.shutdown(1)
    sock.close

def read(self):
    return str(sock.recv(500))

def parseText(self, String):
    ex = String.find('!')
    seperationString = String.find('!')
    messageSender = String[1:seperationString]
    ex = String.find(' ')
    theHost = String[String.find('@') + 1:ex]
    ex = ex + 1
    ex2 = String.find(' ', ex)
    chanMode = String[ex:ex2]
    ex = ex2 + 1
    ex2 = String.find(' ', ex)
    currChannel = String[ex:ex2]
    messageSent = String[String.find(':', 1) + 1:].strip()

    return {'messageSent':messageSent, 'currChannel':currChannel, 'messageSender':messageSender, 'theHost':theHost, 'chanMode':chanMode}
    
def isController(self, theHost):
    f = open('controllers.txt', 'r')
    for line in f.readlines():
        if line.find(theHost) > -1:
            f.close()
            return True
        else:
            continue
    f.close()
    return False

class IRCFun(object):
def sendRaw(self, text):
sock.send(text + ‘\r\n’)

def identify(self, nick, passw, channel):
    self.sendRaw('PASS ' + passw)
    self.sendRaw('NICK ' + nick)
    self.sendRaw('USER ' + nick + ' 8 * :' + nick)
    self.sendRaw('JOIN ' + channel)
    
def joinChan(self, channel):
    self.sendRaw('JOIN '+ channel)
    
def partChan(self, channel):
    self.sendRaw('PART '+ channel)

def kickUser(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('KICK ' + channel + ' ' + user)
    
def chanSend(self, channel, text):
    self.sendRaw('PRIVMSG '+ channel + ' :' + text)

def userSend(self, user, text):
    self.sendRaw('PRIVMSG ' + user + ' :' + text)
    
def noticeUser(self, user, text):
    self.sendRaw('NOTICE ' + user + ' :' + text)
    
def noticeChan(self, channel, text):
    self.sendRaw('NOTICE ' + channel + ' :' + text)
    
def changeMode(self, channel, mode):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' ' + mode)
    
def giveOp(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' +o ' + user)

def removeOp(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' -o ' + user)

def giveHalfop(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' +h ' + user)

def removeHalfop(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' -h ' + user)

def giveVoice(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' +v ' + user)
    
def removeVoice(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' -v ' + user)

def giveAdmin(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' +a ' + user)
    
def removeAdmin(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' -a ' + user)

def giveFounder(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' +q ' + user)
    
def removeFounder(self, channel, user):
    self.sendRaw('MODE ' + channel + ' -q ' + user)[/code]

Virgo - The bot:

import Pythirc
import sys
import re
from time import sleep

print "Pythirc - Welcome \n"
connection = Pythirc.IRCon('irc.deltaanime.net', 6667)
IRCFunc = Pythirc.IRCFun()
IRCFunc.identify("Virgo", "Pass", "#bots")

while 1:
    read = connection.read()
    ugly = read
    removeUgly = re.compile(":(.+?)!(.+?)@(.+?) (.+?) (.+?) :(.+)") 
    match = removeUgly.search(ugly)
        
    if match:
        cleaned = "[" + match.group(1) + "/" + match.group(4) + "/" + match.group(5) + "]: " + match.group(6)
        print cleaned
    
    var = None

    if read.startswith('PING'):
        space = read.find(' ') + 1
        IRCFunc.sendRaw('PONG ' + read[space:])
        print 'Replied to a PONG - ' + read[space:]

    if read.startswith(':'):
        var = connection.parseText(read)

    if var is not None:
        messageSent = var['messageSent']
        messageSender = var['messageSender']
        currChannel = var['currChannel']
        theHost = var['theHost']
        chanMode = var['chanMode']
        
        if messageSent.startswith("!say"):
            toSay = messageSent[messageSent.find(" ") + 1:]
            IRCFunc.chanSend(currChannel, "[" + var['messageSender'] + "]: " + toSay)
            
        if messageSent.startswith("!quit") and connection.isController(theHost):
            sys.exit(1)
        
        if messageSent.startswith("!exec") and connection.isController(theHost):
            code = messageSent[messageSent.find(" ") + 1:]
            try:
                exec(str(code))
            except Exception, e:
                IRCFunc.chanSend(currChannel, ' Error: ' + str(e))

The test bot I have provided only has !say, !quit, and !exec as functions, it’s up to you to build on that. Also, the bot requires a file called “controllers.txt” with your IRC Hostname in it to execute functions that have “and connection.isController(theHost):” on the end.

Read full topic
